introduction: The following passage is adapted from The Man Who Knew Infinity: A Life of the Genius Ramanujan by Robert Kanigel (1991).
text: Kanigel recounts the life of Srinivasa Ramanujan, an Indian mathematician who made extraordinary contributions to number theory. Despite having little formal training, Ramanujan developed formulas and theorems that continue to influence modern mathematics. His collaboration with the British mathematician G.H. question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English? Ensure the verb tense aligns with the historical narrative, and consider how subject-verb agreement affects the sentence structure.
explanation: Choice B is the best answer. The present perfect has transformed appropriately reflects the ongoing influence of Ramanujan and Hardy’s collaboration on mathematics, connecting the historical event to its continuing relevance.
